["975028","249631","English","Spanish",["CLOUD COMPUTING","Cloud computing refers to the logical computational resources (data, software) accessible via a computer network (through WAN or Internet etc.), rather than from a local computer.","The on-line service can be offered from a cloud provider or it could be private organization's own.","In this case these technologies are regarded by some analysts as a technological evolution[1], or are seen as a marketing trap by others like Richard Stallman.","Users or clients can perform a task, such as word processing, mailing, with a client such as browser and with service provided through such cloud based computational resources.","Since the cloud is the underlying delivery mechanism, cloud-based remote applications and services may support any type of software application or service in use today.","In the past, tasks such as word processing were not possible without the installation of software on a local computer.","With the development of local area networks (LAN) and wider bandwidth, multiple CPUs and storage devices could be used to host services like word processing in a remotely managed datacenter.","The Cloud computing takes away the installation and upgrades hassles and need for higher computing power from users and gives more control to the service providers on administration of the services.","Consumers now routinely use data-intensive applications driven by cloud technology that were previously unavailable due to cost and deployment complexity.","[citation needed] In many companies, employees and company departments are bringing a flood of consumer technology into the workplace, which raises legal compliance and security concerns for the corporation.","[citation needed]","The term \"software as a service\" is sometimes used to describe programs offered through \"The Cloud\".","A common shorthand for a provided cloud computing service (or even an aggregation of all existing cloud services) is \"The Cloud\".","An analogy to explain cloud computing is that of public utilities such as electricity, gas, and water.","Centralized and standardized utilities freed individuals from the difficulties of generating electricity or pumping water.","All of the development and maintenance tasks involved in doing so was alleviated.","With Cloud computing, this translates to a reduced cost in software distribution to providers still using hard mediums such as DVDs.","Consumer benefits are that software no longer has to be installed and is automatically updated, but savings in terms of money is yet to be seen.","The principle behind the cloud is that any computer connected to the Internet is connected to the same pool of computing power, applications, and files.","Users can store and access personal files such as music, pictures, videos, and bookmarks or play games or do word processing on a remote server rather than physically carrying around a storage medium such as a DVD or thumb drive.","Even those using web-based email such as Gmail, Hotmail, Yahoo!, a company-owned email, or even an e-mail client program such as Outlook, Evolution, Mozilla Thunderbird, or Entourage are making use of cloud email servers.","Hence, desktop applications that connect to internet-host email providers can also be considered cloud applications.","La computacin en nube se refiere a la reseña computacional logica(data y softwere)accesible por medio de una red de computadoras(a travez de WAN o internet)en lugar de una computadora local.","El servicio en linea puede ser ofrecido desde un proveedor de nuve o este podria ser nuestra organizacion privada.","en este caso estas tecnologias estan relacionadas por algunos analistas como una evolucion tecnologica.","Usuarios o clientes pueden realizar una tarea, tal como procesamiento de palabras, mensajeria, con un cliente tales como buscadores y con servicio brindado por tales recursos computacionales basados en nuves.","desde que la nuve es el mecanismo de linea deliverado nuves basadas en aplicaciones remotas y servicios puedn soportar cualquier tipo de aplicacion de softwere o servicio en uso actualmente.","en el pasado, tareas tales como el procesamiento de palabras donde esto no era posible sin la instalacion de un softwere en una computadora local.","Con el dessarrollo de las redes de area local(LAN) y ancho de banda multiles CPU y herrmamientas de almacenamiento podria ser usado en servicio host, like procesamiento de palabras y en manejo remoto de datacenters.","el cloud computing toma siempre la instalacion y las molestas actualizaciones y necesita una alta potencia y necesaria para computacion de alta potencia hacia usuarios y da mayor control a los proveedires de servicios sobre administracion de servicios.","los consumidores ahora rutinariamnete utilizan aplicaiones de data-intensiva manejadas por una tecnologia de nube que donde "],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["857663","88711","English","Spanish",["\"Designer Baby\"","Last week, I heard in the local news in my country that for the first time in Spain a baby was born without a genetic mutation that increases the risk of breast cancer.","I was really amazed because I was aware of the profound ethical debate that has been taking place in the previous years regarding the dangers of what is colloquially known as \"designer baby\" and genetic modification of human beings.","Nevertheless, when I read the article more carefully , I found out that, in fact, what they had done was a procedure known as \"Pre-implantation Genetic Diagnosis\" or PIGD.","In summary, the procedure uses in vitro fertilization of eggs and sperm form the parents, and then, a screening for a given trait (the genetic mutation in this case) is performed so that only the desired embryos are implanted back into the mother.","That is, all of the embryos that carry the genetic mutation are discarded.","PIGD does not involve any kind of genetic modification, instead it is an in vitro selection procedure.","Nonetheless, this is still very controversial given that by performing this procedure not all the embryos obtained are given the same opportunity to implant and develop into a fetus (as would have been the case if no artificial selection was applied).","I think that the application of this kind of procedures was both foreseen and inevitable.","With the advent of new techniques in molecular biology and colossal amounts of information about our genome and how it can be used to predict our risk of developing a given disease, it is just natural that more and more examples of this kind of application are going to be seen in the near future.","It is up to us to be informed about this subject so that we can support certain laws and regulations that could eventually protect us from the dangers resulting from inappropriate use of this technology."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]
["859272","88711","English","Spanish",["Lies","Sometimes we lie not because we have evil intentions but because saying the truth would be too rude or inappropriate.","The thing is that usually we get caught eventually, and all the effort done in order to be polite ends up being useless and deteriorates the relationship we wanted to protect.","Lying is very easy.","It takes a lot of courage and self-confidence to be candid and outspoken, but I think it is worth the effort.","It feels right to say that the truth is always the right answer, but sometimes the truth can cause more harm than a lie.","I wish there was a magical formula or equation that told us when it is appropriate to choose one over the other."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["220470","10538","English","Spanish",["2.2 Ruta del Inka Project","2.2.","Because of the great distance between Tiahuanaco (Bolivia) and Tikal (Guatemala), the expedition will have duration of 71 days, from 21st of June till the 30th of August of 2010.","In the same way it has been decided to divide the journey in two parts of 35 days each one, participants will simulate a sort of sentry post, emulating the old chasquis (Inka’s postman)."],[[],[],[],[]]]
["220490","10538","English","Spanish",["2.2.1. Ruta del Inka Project","2.2.1.","In this sense, a first group of 200 students selected from different regions of the planet will participate starting from Tiwanaku (Bolivia), culminating their journey in Capurgana (Colombia) on Sunday 25th of July.","From that privileged point of tranquil beaches of white sand participants will be back to their countries.","A group of directives and journalist of Ruta Inka will navigate from this point till Puerto Obadia, in Panamanian territory  in order to take a light air craft who will drive them to Panama City and continue the crossing with the second group summoned to take the sentry on this route."],[[],[],[],[],[]]]

["30608","5569","English","Spanish",["Museums","Since the beginning of this semester; every Tuesday I’ve been going to a different museum.","Is interesting, because we go with the purpose of analyze the structure and the operation of the institutions; we try to see their challenges and the way in which every institution tries to solve them.","The museums in Mexico have serious problems, they don’t have money which is important to actualize some areas or the publicity; the worst part is that the people that work in there sometimes try their best but the institutions of which they depend are not interested in the work of the museum.","(Actually, the worst part is that there is no public).","There’re a few museums that are trying to grow and that receive all the support from the institution that maintain them: Centro Cultural Universitario Tlatelolco (University Cultural Centre of Tlatelolco), Museo de la Luz (Museum of Light) and the Universum (Science Museum), There’s a museum of art that’s making a lot of noise, Museo Universitario de Arte Contemporáneo (University Museum of Contemporary Art) but that’s not ready yet, the inauguration is programmed for November, although the inauguration has been moved several times, it was supposed to open in 2006!","Well, these cultural institutions are the best (or should I say: not as bas as the others?) and all of them depend of the Universidad Autónoma de México (National Autonomous University of Mexico).","I think that all the museums of Mexico should check the works of universities, to actualize their programs, their objectives and to focus in the problems of the contemporary Mexico, not the Mexico of the 1950’s."],[[],["[f-red]Every Tuesday,[\/f-red] since the beginning of this semester, [sline]; every Tuesday[\/sline] I’ve been going to a different museum."],["I[f-red]t'[\/f-red]s interesting, because we go [sline]with the purpose of[\/sline] [f-red]to[\/f-red] analyze the structure[f-red]s[\/f-red] and the operation of the institutions; we try to see their challenges and the way in which every institution tries to solve them."],["The museums in Mexico have serious problems[f-red].[\/f-red] [f-red]T[\/f-red]hey don’t have money[f-red],[\/f-red] which is important to [sline]actualize[\/sline] [f-red]finalize[\/f-red] some areas [f-red]f[\/f-red]or the public[sline]ity[\/sline][f-red].[\/f-red] [f-red]T[\/f-red]he worst part is that the people that work [sline]in[\/sline] there sometimes try their best[f-red],[\/f-red] but the institutions of which they depend [f-red]on[\/f-red] are not interested in the work of the museum."],[],["The[f-red]s[\/f-red]e [f-red]a[\/f-red]re a few museums that are trying to grow[f-red],[\/f-red] [sline]and that[\/sline] [f-red]which[\/f-red] receive [sline]all the[\/sline] support from the institution[f-red]s[\/f-red] that maintain them: Centro Cultural Universitario Tlatelolco (University Cultural Centre of Tlatelolco), Museo de la Luz (Museum of Light) and the Universum (Science Museum)[f-red].[\/f-red] There’s a museum of art that’s making a lot of noise[f-red]:[\/f-red] the Museo Universitario de Arte Contemporáneo (University Museum of Contemporary Art), but [sline]that's[\/sline] [f-red]it[\/f-red] [f-red]isn't[\/f-red] [sline]not[\/sline] ready yet[f-red];[\/f-red] the inauguration is [sline]programmed[\/sline][f-red] scheduled[\/f-red] for Novembe[f-red]r. ["64235","5569","English","Spanish",["New Year's Eve in Mexico","New Year’s Eve here, is not as special as Christmas.","The biggest difference is that Christmas is a special night to spend with your family, at home or a relative’s home; and New Year’s Eve you can spend it with friends, boyfriends and family and you can go to a restaurant or a bar.","In general, we don’t have special food for tonight.","Because Mexicans cooks a lot of food for Christmas, so it’s usual to repeat the Christmas' dinner, and prepare just a salad or pasta to don’t dinner exactly the same.","Some families (not mine) tend to spend Christmas with the mother’s relatives and New Year with father’s relatives (or vice versa).","And that’s also the reason to “repeat” the Christmas’ dinner, like a second-dinner for those who couldn’t come on Christmas.","I’m going to celebrate New Year with my parents and my brother.","We already have a big table with cheese, cold cuts and bread; then we’re going to cook salmon on the grill, we’ll eat pasta, vegetables and we’ll drink wine and “mojitos”.","Do you know “mojitos\"?","Happy New Year!!"],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]
["76623","5569","English","Spanish",["Tacos","Hey!","In this post I want to talk about one of the most famous foods of Mexico: Tacos.","Tacos are the easiest dish of Mexican food.","It’s so simple and fast to do it, that is one of the most sold foods down the street.","You only need a fill and a ‘tortilla’ to prepare it.","Traditionally the tortilla is made up of corn.","Nowadays there are wheat-tortilla and even nopal-tortilla.","The taco's instructions are very simple:","Over the tortilla put the fill and roll up the tortilla around the fill.","But what is the fill?","That’s something fantastic; tacos don’t have a special fill.","You can eat a vegetables-taco or salt-taco, egg-taco, cheese-taco… But the most common is meat-taco, any kind of meat: beef, chicken, pork…","One of the most famous tacos in Mexico are the “tacos al pastor”.","Some think, that these tacos were invented by the Mexican-Lebanese community.","Tacos al pastor are made in a thing called “trompo”.","The meat is marinated with some species and chili, to give the meat their fantastic flavor and its brightly orange color, then is placed like in a big brochette.","The “trompo” spins in front of the fire, and the meat cooks.","The meat-tacos are commonly served with three things: onion, cilantro and “salsa”.","But the tacos al pastor have one more ingredient: pineapple.","The resultant flavor is fantastic, kind of spicy and sweet.","The taco in the right is “taco al pastor”, the left one is a “taco de alambre”.","“Alambre” is some meat with pepper, onion and cheese.","So the combinations are infinite!!","The tacos are eaten with the hand, and there is a saying that says: “En el modo de agarrar el taco se conoce al que es tragón” That means something like: “The way in which you hold your taco, denounces if you’re a glutton” ","I think is true!","This is my brother’s hand."],[[],[],["In this post I want to talk about one of the most famous foods [f-red]from[\/f-red] Mexico: Tacos."],["Tacos are the easiest dish [f-red]to make out[\/f-red] of [f-red]all[\/f-red] Mexican food[f-red]s[\/f-red]."],["It’s so [f-red]quick and easy[\/f-red] to [f-red]prepare[\/f-red], that i[f-red]t'[\/f-red]s one of the most sold foods down the street[f-red]s of Mexico[\/f-red]. [f-blue](quick and easy is a very common English phrase. \"Simple and fast\" is not wrong, but when speaking, people will tend to use the common phrase.)[\/f-blue]"],["You only need [f-red]filling[\/f-red] and a ‘tortilla’ to prepare it."],[],[],["The taco[f-red][sline]'s[\/sline][\/f-red] instructions are very simple:"],["[f-red]Put the filling on top of the tortilla,[\/f-red] and roll up the tortilla around [f-red]it[\/f-red]."],["But[f-red],[\/f-red] what is the fill[f-red]ing[\/f-red]?"],["That’s [f-red]the best thing about it[\/f-red]; tacos don’t have a special fill[f-red]ing[\/f-red]."],["You can eat [f-red][sline]a[\/sline][\/f-red] [f-red]vegetable tacos[\/f-red], or [f-red]salt tacos[\/f-red], [f-red]egg tacos[\/f-red], [f-red]cheese tacos[\/f-red]… But the most common is [f-red]meat tacos[\/f-red], any kind of meat: beef, chicken, pork… [f-blue](you don't need the hyphen for \"vegetable[f-red]-[\/f-red]taco\" etc, just write the words separately)[\/f-blue]"],[],[],["Tacos al pastor are made [f-red]with[\/f-red] a thing called “trompo”. ["124533","5569","English","Spanish",["Oaxaca","Last week was “Semana Santa” and in Mexico we had holidays!","I went to the state of Oaxaca with my family, it was pretty cool.","I thought that I would eat a lot of delicious food, but I think that the food of Oaxaca has nothing special.","And everywhere I went, they have the same dishes!","Something that is delicious in Oaxaca is the cheese, there is a kind of cheese called “Oaxaca Cheese” it tastes good and it's very fun to eat it, because when you try to eat it, the cheese get extended and extended, especially when it's hot.","In the image you can see how the Oaxaca cheese is made.","Near Oaxaca City there is a little town called: Santa Maria del Tule, this place is famous because in the atrium of the church there is one of the biggest trees of the world.","The tree isn’t big… IT IS HUGE!!","Age: 2000 years","Width: 58 m","Height: 42m","Diameter: 14m"],[[],[],[],[],[],["Something that is delicious in Oaxaca is the cheese, there is a kind of cheese called “Oaxaca Cheese” it tastes good and it's very fun to eat it, because when you try to eat it, the cheese [f-blue]stretches[\/f-blue], especially when it's hot."],["In the image you can see how Oaxaca cheese is made."],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]
["70400","5569","English","Spanish",["King's Day","“Día de reyes”.","I think is one of the biggest dates for the Mexican children (although not for the parents).","The day has his origins in the bible’s story about the three kings or wise men that gave gifts to the baby Jesus.","On January 5th, the children put a shoe outside their bedrooms with a letter, asking for presents (usually toys).","They also can send the letter on a balloon; it’s fun to see the trees around those days, because you can see many balloons that get caught by the trees and didn’t make his way to the sky.","On the night of January 5th, the three kings leave the presents in the children's house.","On the morning of January 6th, the children wake up and find their toys, the streets are empty.","All the children are in home playing with their new toys.","My favorite part of “Día de Reyes” (maybe because I’m no longer a girl and I don’t receive toys anymore) is the “Rosca de Reyes”.","It’s ring-shaped bread.","The bread is so delicious; it’s made with anise and orange.","On top it has some crystallized fruits.","Inside the bread, it’s hidden a little figure of plastic (in the beginning was a porcelain figure) of a boy; it’s supposed to be the kid-Jesus, but we call it ‘mono’ (the boy-doll, its kind of pejorative) or ‘muñequito’ (the little boy-doll).","If you are eating your bread and you find something :), you probably are eating the muñequito’s feet.","But that’s something to celebrate!","Because that means that you’re the godfather of the boy Jesus and you’re going to throw a party on February 2nd, the special food for that day is ‘tamales’."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]
["29980","5569","English","Spanish",["Art gallery","Last week I went to an art gallery, nowadays there are a lot of them in some areas of Mexico City.","Personally I don’t like galleries; it seems that when you’re a student and you don’t have enough money to buy, the people that work there sometimes get bored with your visit.","It’s an uncomfortable feeling, and I don’t like it.","This time, the visit was different because we went to the gallery with the purpose to speak with the directives, not to see not to buy art.","The director of the gallery was a young man who willingly accepted to answer all our questions about the administration of an art institution and the general panorama of the contemporary art in Mexico.","Perhaps, the next time that I’ll visit an art gallery, I’ll look at it with a different perspective.","It was a very interesting day."],[[],[],[],[],["This time, the visit was different because we went to the gallery with the purpose [sline]to speak with[\/sline] [f-blue]of speaking to the[\/f-blue] directives, not to see [sline]not to[\/sline] [f-blue]or [\/f-blue]buy art."],["The director of the gallery was a young man who willingly accepted to answer all [f-blue]of[\/f-blue] our questions about the administration of an art institution and the general panorama of the contemporary art in Mexico."],["Perhaps, the next time that I[f-bold][sline]'ll[\/sline][\/f-bold] visit an art gallery, I’ll look at it with a different perspective."],[]]]

["69681","15072","English","Spanish",["Scouts","Scouting is a worldwide youth movement that aims to develop the physical, spiritual and mental potential of young people in order to become good citizens.","This movement was founded in 1907 by the British Baden-Powell, who also set the principles of scouting.","Nowadays there are currently over 38 million member in 216 countries, and this is still spreading.","The range of ages ranging from 6 to 25 years old, so the scouts are divided into age groups, which are:","from 11 to 17 years old: boy\/girl scout","upper 18 years old: rover\/ranger scout","These age's groups then are rearranging in patrols baptised with animal's names.","The scout's activities are mainly outdoors, like camping, hiking or sports, but also they learn to respect the nature and survive into the wild, for that they are instructed in first aid too.","This community organized each 4 years a huge global scout's event known as \"Jamboree\", where scouts from around the world meet.","Scouts wear uniforms a have their own symbols.","The uniform consisted in a shirt full with merit badges and other patches, and a coloured neckerchief.","The principal symbol is undoubtedly the blossom Liz which represents several meanings:","The three petals mean loyalty, selflessness and purity.","The stars symbolize the scout's law and commitment.","The needle in the the centre indicates the north, making the path.","The ring joining the petals represents the brotherhood among the scouts and the rope reinforces that, remembering that this fellowship doesn't make any differences among ethnicities, religions and social classes.","Finally the knot means that overcoming gets achieved with hard work and dedication."],[[],[],[],["[sline]Nowadays[\/sline] There ["859980","231591","English","Spanish",["Cultural Intelligence","Hi!","I'm trying to transcribe this video explanation: ","http:\/\/vimeo.com\/13306690","That's what I've understood but I'm not sure if it's correct or not and there are also some words which are impossible to understand for me:","What factors determine the way I am?","What makes up my culture?","Why is my culture so different from others?","What is this person like?","Why are they this way?","The action of moving across cultures is a different and challenging one.","It requires a degree of adjustment and adaptation that is not found in any other type of social interaction, because so many aspects of the new situation differ from the prior ones.","To make things more difficult, many of the rules that we learn in one or in more than in one culture may not be useful in a new culture.","In fact, many of the lessons learnt in one culture would often interfere with successful adaptation in a new culture.","Culture adaptation is a bit of moving target and requires and requires a set of highly complex cognitive and meta-cognitive skills.","Consisting with conceptual framework of education of philosophers, like Johan Dewey, _____ and David Cole, cultural intelligence or CQ approaches the task of becoming multi-culturally affective and fruitful to the leads of motivation, cognition and behavior.","These components have been researched and found to be applicable in the attempt to provide leathers to their survival kit to improve and enhance their willingness to be cross-cultural, their capacity to be successful cross-cultural agents and their ability to adapt and adjust to different cultural situations.","Because of the immense challenges poised by demanding to interact in multi-cultural situations, CQ is a survival kit.","Due to CQ Enhancement Seminar, sponsored by the US Canada regional office, we seek to equip persons with the survival kit because the church is called upon to minister not only the persons who are like us but if the truth be told we do ministry amongst the persons and people groups who live in a cultural vastly different from our own.","On that fateful day in April 1970 when the spacecraft Apollo 13th found itself in difficulty, we heard those unforgettable words: “Houston, we have a problem”.","This was not a call to surrender or capitulate; it was a summons to creativity, inspiration, passion and perseverance.","The words of the crew space sponsor from missing control on Earth still resonate with us today: “Failure is not an option”.","The result of that famous oft was a successful recovery of the mission.","The CQ survival kit embraces those words on behalf of those who are willing to respond to the called to ministry cross-culturally “Failure is not an option”.","As the seminar will show there are four essential tools in the survival kit for improving one’s cross-cultural effectiveness and these four tools provide the answer to 49 questions asked for those who are involved in this challenging ministry.","Tool number 1 is CQ Drive.","This provides answers to questions: What’s my motivation?","What’s my level of confidence and motivation for this cross-cultural assignment?","If it’s lucking, what can I do to increase it?","Leaders with high CQ Drive are motivated to learn and adapt to new and diverse cultural settings.","They’re confidence and they’re adapting abilities are likely to influence the very way they perform across cultural situations.","Tool number 2 is CQ Knowledge.","This provides answers to the questions: What do I need to know?","What cultural understanding do I need for this cross-cultural assignment?","Leaders with high CQ Knowledge have a rich, well, organized understanding of “culture” and how it affects the way people think and behave.","They possess a repertoire of knowledge in knowing how cultures are alike and different.","They understand how culture shapes behavior.","Tool number 3 is CQ Strategy.","This provides answers to the questions: How should I plan?","What do I need to plan in order to do this cross-cultural assignment successfully?","Leaders with high CQ Strategy develop ways to use cultural understanding to develop a plan for new cross-cultural situations.","These leaders are better able to monitor, analyze and adjust their behaviors in different cultural settings.","They’re conscious of what they need to know about a non-familiar culture.","Tool number 4 is CQ Action.","This provides answers to the questions: What behaviors do I need to adjust?","What behaviors should I adapt for this cross-cultural assignment?","Leaders with high CQ Action can drop on the other three dimensions of CQ to translate their enhanced motivation, understanding and planning into interactions.","They process a broad repertoire of behaviors which they can use depending on the context.","The CQ Enhancement Seminar may just be the source the Eurominister needs to guarantee some measure of success in your responds to God’s cultural mission.","And as we become more culturally intelligent, each of us can become more effective on enriching our world with the ¿God's or good?","news while simultaneously making the world a better place."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],["\"LEARNED and LEARNT are both past and past participle forms of the verb LEARN. The difference between them is dialectal, i.e. LEARNED is the usual American form whereas both LEARNED and LEARNT are possible in British English.\" - http:\/\/www.nus.edu.sg\/prose\/grammar.html In my opinion, the word that I heard hear is the American LEARNED because the whole audio recording is in the American dialect of English. : )"],[],["[sline][f-red]Consisting with[\/f-red][\/sline] I'm thinking about the thing I discovered right now\" Pita said.","\"What have you discovered?\"","\"A new word!","A marvelous word!\"","\"What kind of word?\" Tomas inquired with some distrust.","\"A wonderful word.","One of the best I've heard in my life.\"","\"Come on, say it to us, Pita\" the children said.","\"Palitroche!\" Pita said triumphantly.","\"Palitroche?","What's its meaning?","\"I wish I know it!\"","\"If you don't know what it means, it is useless\" Anita said.","\"That worries me\" Pita answered, bitting her right hand thumb.","\"Who say what words mean?\" Tomas asked.","\"I think that some old masters did a meeting\" Pita said.\"They invented some words and later they said: this word means it...",", but no one never thought a word as beautiful as palitroche.","What luck that I found it!","I bet you everything you want that I'll discover what it means!","Maybe it can be used with the noise we make when walking on the mud.","Let's listen to how it sounds: When Anita is walking on the mud a wonderful palitroche can be heard...","No, it doesn't sounds good.","That isn't it.","Maybe it's something which can be bought in stores.","Let's find out it!\"","\"And let's see if we can\" Tomas added.","Pita went to seek her purse and filled it with coins.","\"Palitroche sounds like a thing too expensive.","Probably this money is enough.","Once agreed, they three went out the house."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["667214","141545","English","Spanish",["Hooligans. Part 2","This behavior of a minimum part of football fans began in 70s, in the stadiums of England.","Since then, they have been object a lot of studies.","The ideology of hooligans is varied, but all of the hooligans of the same team have the same ideology.","The fights between different hooligans’ team are happened on matches called “derbis”, a match that face to face teams of the same city, like Chelsea-Arsenal or teams with a huge historical rivalry.","In some cases, these sorts of conflicts have been finished tragedy, like Heysel Stadium disaster occurred on 29 May 1985 in a Champions League Final that confronts Liverpool versus Juventus.","39 football fans died in the incident."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]
["666620","141545","English","Spanish",["Hooligans","Hooligan is an anglicism that was used to refer a person who is football team’s fan and he has destructive and aggressive behaviour into the football stadium and its surrounding.","When the hooligans go to a football match, most of them drink alcohol and are drugged themselves.","This is a cause for their aggressive behaviour.","There are some movies where you can see the conduct and actions of hooligans.","For example “The Football Factory”or “Green Street Hooligans”.","The last case of hooliganism was occurred in Génova, two weeks ago, when a serbian’s hooligan group got to put off a match throwing flares to the field.","The match confronts Italia versus Serbia.","This behavior of a minimum part of football fans began in 70s, in the stadiums of England.","Since then, they have been object a lot of studies.","The ideology of hooligans is varied, but all of the hooligans of the same team have the same ideology.","The fights between different hooligans’ team are happened on matches called “derbis”, a match that face to face teams of the same city, like Chelsea-Arsenal or teams with a huge historical rivalry.","In some cases, these sorts of conflicts have been finished tragedy, like Heysel Stadium disaster occurred on 29 May 1985 in a Champions League Final that confronts Liverpool versus Juventus.","39 football fans died in the incident."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["795231","134245","English","Spanish",["Harmony","The sounds are produced because the matter's vibrations and these can go through gas, liquid or solid state.","When there is a vacuum, it's imposible to reproduce sounds.","This is called silence.","Sounds can superpose and can increase its volume when many of them are played by a similar source.","For example, seven pianos playing the RE tone at the same time will get a higher volumen than only two playing the same tone.","The sounds are classified according a natural scale and is constant for upper or lower position:","Do - Re - Mi - Fa - So - La - Ti - Do - Re - Mi - Fa - So - La - Ti - Do","*Note:  This scale can go more up or more low, depending uppon the musical instrument or the sound'source.","Let´s take point in the central \"DO\".","We can see there also other two \"Do's\", What about them?","Between tones there are \"intervals\" that determines tonal distances.","This is because the number of vibrations in a second, also named Frequency.","The universal LA is stablished as 440 Hz.","This is, 440 vibrations in 2.27 miliseconds.","When going up or down we reach the same tone of departure, we've obtained an Octave.","For example, going from Do to Do, or Mi to Mi.","Its symbol is \"8va\".","This is one of many notable intervals.","There also others as the follows:","1.","In the natural scale, if we take from one tone to the third, this is called simply \"third\" or 3rd:","(1st) Do - (2nd) Re - (3rd) Mi","Do - Do# - Re - Re# - Mi  = 4 half tones = 2 tones","Now, in chromatic scale we can analize there are two tones from Do to Mi.","This is a MAJOR 3RD.","2.","Once again, in the natural scale let's take from Mi to So.","We're going to see what happens now.","(1st) Mi - (2nd) Fa - (3rd) So","But wait, according to the chromatic scale there half tone from Mi to Fa, altering the interval.","Mi - Fa - Fa# - So   = 3 half tones = 1 and half tones","So, Is it still a 3rd interval?","The answer is YES.","But, instead of be a major 3rd, this is called MINOR 3RD.","3.","Let's going to joint these intervals in different ways to experiment a little.","a) By playing Major 3rd + Minor 3rd.","From the example, taking DO - MI and MI - So, this is equal to DO - MI - SO.","b) By playing Minor 3rd + Major 3rd.","Taking MI - SO and SO - SI, this is equal to MI - SO - SI.","Now, put these tones in your piano.","Is it sound good, right?","When you pick a major 3rd and then a minor 3rd we obtain a Major CHORD.","This is called Do major cause it begins in Do as a base tone.","What is a chord?","It´s a arrange of tones.","For example, So - Si - Re build So major.","You musn´t get worried for obtain the others, there exist a sheet explain all the major and minor chords.",";)","There also a nomenclature for those chords.","This based on the alphabet letters and begins with La major.","A = La major                    Am = La minor","B = Si major                    Bm = Si minor","C = Do major                    Cm = Do minor","D = Re major                    Dm = Re minor","E = Mi major                    Em = Mi minor","F = Fa major                    Fm = Fa minor","G = So major                    Gm = So minor","Those can be played all along the piano and you'll be noticed they'll sound somelike similar.","This is because the 8va's properties.","Activities:","I.","Play all the chords with both hands in the piano (also you can practice with your musical keyboard or with your computer keyboard).","Try to alternate your fingers and find a comfortable position for your hands, them must to be relaxed while you're playing."],[[],["The sounds are produced because [f-red]of [\/f-red]the vibrations [f-blue]as it passes through [\/f-blue]matter. [f-blue]Sounds [\/f-blue]can [f-blue]travel [\/f-blue]through gas, liquid or solid state[f-red]s[\/f-red]."],["When there is a vacuum, it's impos[f-red]s[\/f-red]ible to reproduce sounds."],[],["Sounds can super[f-red][\/f-red]pose and can increase [f-red]in[\/f-red] volume when many of them are played by a similar source."],["For example, seven pianos playing the RE tone at the same time will get a higher [f-red]volume[\/f-red] than only two playing the same tone."],["The sounds are classified according [f-red]to[\/f-red] a natural scale and [f-red]are[\/f-red] constant for upper or lower position[f-red]s[\/f-red]:"],[],["*Note: This scale can go [f-red]further [\/f-red]up or [f-red]further down[\/f-red], depending [f-red]upon[\/f-red] the musical instrument or the sound source."],["Let´s take, [f-red]for example,[\/f-red] the central \"DO\"."],[],[],["This is because [f-red]of [\/f-red]the number of vibrations in a second, also named Frequency."],["The universal LA is [f-red]e[\/f-red]stablished as 440 Hz."],["This is 440 vibrations in 2.27 miliseconds."],["When going up or down we reach the same tone of departure: we've obtained an Octave."],[],[],[],["There [f-red]are [\/f-red]also others as [sline][f-red]the[\/f-red][\/sline] follows:"],[],["In the natural scale, if we [f-red][f-blue]go[\/f-blue][\/f-red] from one tone to the third, this is called simply \"third\" or 3rd: [f-blue]Not sure what you mean here by 'take'?[\/f-blue]"],[],[],["Now, in chromatic scale[f-red],[\/f-red] we can [f-red]analyze[\/f-red] [f-red]that [\/f-red]there are two tones from Do to Mi."],[],[],["Once again, in the natural scale, let's [f-blue]go[\/f-blue] from Mi to So. [f-blue]If that's what you meant?[\/f-blue]"],[],[],["But wait; according to the chromatic scale there [f-red]is a [\/f-red]half tone from Mi to Fa, altering the interval."],[],["So, [f-red]is[\/f-red] it still a 3rd interval?"],[],["But, instead of be[f-red]ing[\/f-red] a major 3rd, this is called MINOR 3RD."],[],["Let's [sline][f-red]going to [\/f-red][\/sline] [f-red]join[\/f-red] these intervals in different ways to experiment a little."],[],[],[],[],["Now, [f-blue]play[\/f-blue] these tones [f-blue]on[\/f-blue] your piano."],["[f-red]It [\/f-red]sound[f-red]s[\/f-red] good, right?"],[],["This is called Do major [f-red]because [\/f-red]it begins in Do as a base tone."],[],["It´s a[f-red]n[\/f-red] arrange[f-red]ment[\/f-red] of tones."],["For example, So - Si - Re build[f-red]s[\/f-red] So major."],["You musn´t get worried [f-red]about [\/f-red]obtain[f-red]ing[\/f-red] the others, there exist[f-red]s[\/f-red] a sheet explain[f-red]ing[\/f-red] all the major and minor chords."],[],[],["This [f-red]is[\/f-red] based on the letters [f-blue]of the alphabet [\/f-blue]and begins with La major."],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],["Those can be played all along the piano and you'll [sline][f-red]be [\/f-red][\/sline][f-red]notice that[\/f-red] they'll sound [f-red]somewhat [\/f-red]similar."],["This is because [f-red]of[\/f-red] the[f-red][\/f-red] 8va's properties."],[],[],["Play all the chords with both hands [f-red]on[\/f-red] the piano (you can [f-red]also [\/f-red]practice with your musical keyboard or with your computer keyboard)."],["Try to alternate your finger [f-blue]position [\/f-blue]and find a comfortable position for your hands, the[f-red]y[\/f-red] must [sline][f-red]to [\/f-red][\/sline]be relaxed while you're playing."]]]
["714920","134245","English","Spanish",["About music...","Hi!, My name is Antonio.","I'm going to explain along this journal, the basics topics for understand the music and how to performance good songs.","First, the music is a couple of sounds and silence.","The sounds are produced 'cause vibrations in matter, then its movement creates acoustic waves.","These can be transmitted by gas, liquid or solid state of matter and can be heard by human.","Silence is the absense of sound.","The sounds' characteristics are chime, volume and tone.","Chime is a recognizable, because it makes you can differ one musical instrument from other.","For example: The guitar' sound and the piano' sound.","No one instrument is better than other, all they are different.","Even in people you know, you can recognize your mom´s voice from your dad's voice because this feature.","Volume is the acoustic wave's intensity.","The more near you're from the sound' source, the most strong you'll hear it.","Finally, Tone is the feature that do possible the making of many songs.","Exist 7 tones in the Natural Scale: Do, Re, Mi, Fa, So, La and Ti.","Also, there is the Chromatic Scale where between two tones, we can find a middle one.","For example: Between Do and Re, there is a middle tone.","This can be named Do#.","Between Mi and Fa, and Ti and Do there are not middle tones.","The complete Chromatic Scale is this:","Do - Do# - Re - Re# - Mi - Fa - Fa# - So - So# - La - La# - Ti","In this Scale, every tone is considered as half - tones.","FIRST CHAPTER'S QUESTIONS:","What's the best musical instrument in the world?","Do you think the noise has chime, volume and tone?","How many tones has the Natural Scale?","How many half - tones has the Chromatic Scale?","What's your favorite musical instrument?","Do you know the music can transmitte feelings, ideas and thoughts?","PRACTICE THIS!","In a musical keyboard, touch the white keys.","This notes are the Natural Scale.","After doing this, touch a white key and then then touch the next black key.","When you include in your song the white and the black ones, you're playing in the Chromatic Scale."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["489126","152234","English","Spanish",["If you take my meaning--reloaded","Language is complicated not because of its structure, which after all is just a code, like C++, Thai or Spanish, but because of the fact that the people using it are not machines, but something infinitely more complex: social biological machines.","I think it goes more or less like this:","They assume you *mean* something whenever you *say* something and they respond accordingly.","What you say is just a piece of input for the other person to think about and then say something else; *that* is what makes language complicated, the social animal behind the language!","Through these cycles of \"listen, think and say,\" we all miss the \"listen\" part every now and then; other times we miss the \"think\" part too, and answer only with messages we capture from the social environment.","Judiciously coordinating the thinking and the listening is no small task.","Nobody misses the say.","Oh boy, we all want to have a say, don't we?","The Greeks used the term \"paradoxa\" to mean something that is outside the realm of what you can understand with the intellectual tools you have at hand.","Whenever language is involved, I'm always reminded of the two-generals paradox: Two generals are camped near a city they are poised to attack the next morning, with their armies and all.","In order to synchronize their efforts, one of them sends a messenger so the other general will know the precise time that the attack is meant to be deployed.","But mind you, it is essential that success or failure of this informative mission is confirmed by the message's recipient.","You see what the problem is: an unending loop of messages and counter-messages is generated, and the whole thing is never ascertained, because: did the other one get my message?"],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["789900","85335","English","Spanish",["Ways to Improve my Knowledge of Spanish Linguistics ","I am a native speaker of Spanish.","Spanish linguistics is a  very interesting field to me.","When I was learning English as a second language at the National University of Colombia, I took many linguistics classes.","My university philosophy stated that in order to learn a second language you needed to know your mother tongue very well.","So I took the following classes: Spanish for different purposes (I and II), Grammar, Linguistics (I and II), Psycholinguistics, Sociolinguistics and Text linguistics.","After that I did not see my mother tongue the same way anymore and I started to think in metalinguistic terms.","Also, learning a second language helped me improve  my vocabulary in my native language because of the similar words and become more familiar with conjugations.","I  love reading and I prefer to read in Spanish.","I also like to teach Spanish as a hobby so I belong to a language exchange website named Lang8.","Here people who are learning a second language like Spanish write journals and native speakers of that language correct those journals in exchange of corrections for their journals.","I spend considerable time correcting this journals and having discussions with other native speaker of Spanish about our corrections.","When we make corrections we explain grammar rules and give options to say things in different Spanish accents.","This type of mentorship makes me trigger many language questions and encourages me to do research in order to support my native speaker instinct.","I also took a translation class in Georgia State where I learnt a lot about English and Spanish.","I also spend time volunteering in an subbing website.","Here I ["678827","85335","English","Spanish",["Fossilization ","Fossilization in language term that refers to \"the often-observed loss of progress in the acquisition of a second language, following a period where learning occurred.\" This is a stage than many of us experienced after achieving certain language level.","The more advanced you get, the harder it is to see improvements in you language skills.","Then, you may lose motivation which is an important aspect of learning.","You also make specific mistakes often and it is very difficult to correct them.","I have learned this term before and I can perfectly identify with it.","I have to write 8 page journals every Friday for a class.","My teacher knows that English is my second language but she still wants my papers to be perfect.","I am already doing my best but she keeps asking me to be more careful with my mistakes.","For example, I do not know how to tell her that sometimes I write \"this\" instead of \"these\" because when I speak I do not make a difference in pronunciation, therefore; this is reflected in my writing.","I do not know how to make her understand that it is a \"fossilized\" error.","I understand her request for perfect grammar but I am giving my best already..."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["823073","85335","English","Spanish",["Conferences","During the weekend of March 12-13, 2010, I had a great experience when I attended the 2010 annual conference “Discovering the Power of Language” given by the Foreign Language Association of Georgia (FLAG).","There were two talks that I enjoyed very much.","First, I was inspired by the talk given by Greg Sanchez, “The Joy of Writing and Singing your own Songs!","No Experience Necessary!”.","There, I learned that many popular songs use simple musical structures, which I can use to make my own songs.","For example, I can create a different version of the song “La bamba”.","Mr.","Sanchez gave us a PowerPoint with a tool that can play important guitar notes.","We can use these important notes to play a song.","During this, talk we created lyrics for some popular songs and it was very entertaining.","Second, I was impressed with the activities presented by Cynthia Alby and others, “Teaching Vocabulary to Tactile and Kinesthetic Learners”.","They explained that many students in our classrooms are tactile\/kinesthetic learners, but most vocabulary instructions and review is geared toward visual or auditory learners.","During their talk, we experience hands-on vocabulary activities.","I remember very vividly how we wrote short words on our partners back using our fingers while our partner had to guess what word it was.","The purpose of the activity was to practice the spelling of new vocabulary words.","I thought it was a very interesting approach for teaching vocabulary."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],["Sanchez gave us a PowerPoint [f-blue]presentation [\/f-blue]with a tool that can play important guitar notes."],[],["During [f-blue]this talk[\/f-blue] we created lyrics for some popular songs and it was very entertaining."],[],["They explained that many students in our classrooms are tactile\/kinesthetic learners, but most vocabulary instructions and review [f-blue]are[\/f-blue] geared toward visual or auditory learners. ["740021","85335","English","Spanish",["Christmas in Colombia","In Colombia, we celebrate Christmas on the 24th.","The gifts are opened at midnight and every one is hungover for the 25th.","Christmas is very different from the way the US celebrates it.","My family was very poor and I lived in a small town.","My mom was a dress maker.","Our tradition is that on the 24th, you were new clothes, go to church and party like crazy.","I was the happiest little girl wearing my new outfits.","I would also get a new outfit for New Year's Eve and that would be the two only new outfits I would get for the rest of the year.","Santa Clause did not gave us presents.","That guy was only in movies.","We got presents from Baby Jesus.","However, my mom used to tell me that since Baby Jesus was so poor and he lived in a stable, he did not have money for a gift that year.","It was not important if I did not get a gift because my cousins did so we would play with their toys in the 25th.","The 24th was only work for my mother .","Many people asked her to make new clothes for that night but they payed her during the next year.","Then, my mom used the sewing machine until 11:30pm.","At 11:30, she would say \"Feliz Navidad\" to us and hide because she hated to interact with so many people.","For the rest of the neighborhood, people would dance, drink and eat the whole night.","When it was midnight, everyone would go from house to house to say \"Feliz Navidad\" with a kiss and a hug.","Without exaggerating, everyone would kiss and hug at least 40 people from midnight to 1am.","The next day, the 25th, was for people to sleep all they wanted and cure their hungover.","For that, some families went to the pool or the river and cook grilled meet or make a delicious Sancocho.","I am not sure if I miss all that.","It was always very intense.","However, my Colombians friends will be in a big party tonight while I will be going out for dinner and going to the movies."],[[],[],["The gifts are opened at midnight and [f-blue]everyone[\/f-blue] is hungover [f-blue]on[\/f-blue] the 25th."],[],["My family was very poor and [f-blue]we[\/f-blue] lived in a small town."],["My mom was a [f-blue]dressmaker[\/f-blue]. This is because: 1) This line is saying almost same thing as the preceding line. 2) The expression \"毎日\" is repeated.[\/f-blue]"],["[f-red]It [\/f-red]was a really happy time"],["本当に幸せ[sline][f-red]の[\/f-red][\/sline][f-blue][f-bold]な[\/f-bold][\/f-blue]頃だった。"],[],["本当に[sline][f-red]静かの頃[\/f-red][\/sline][f-blue]穏やかな時間だった。[\/f-blue]"]]]

(\"Furthermore\" sounds very formal. People rarely use this in everyday speech. It´s correct but it sounds stuffy. Better to leave it out or replace it with \"anyway\" or \"he told me that\".)"],["In conclusion, at this moment I don’t know what I want to do in the future, but I know that I want to do something that I really like and[f-blue] to[\/f-blue] continue studying languages always because I love it."]]]

["481287","7249","English","Spanish",["Everybody's Fine (2009)","Today, I watched Everybody’s fine.","The first time I knew about it was when I was waiting for the subway.","There was a very big banner with the poster of the movie.","I thought it could be OK watching Robert De Niro, Drew Barrimore and so on.","This movie is about a man with four grown-up children.","He expected too much from his children and pushed them quite hard.","The one who listened to them was their mum, but she died 8 months ago.","This father decides to go and visit all of them, as a surprise, but he ends up staying in each house one day and every one lies to him.","After this trip, he learns some things about parents behaviour and relationships between fathers and sons.","This movie is quite slow.","I guess it’s just because the main character is slow, but this kind of movie needs things to be fast, or they get boring.","There aren’t many things to happen, really.","Also, at the end, it seems more like a documental on “how you should treat your children: what’s good for them and what is not”.","In short, I didn’t like it.","I didn’t feel anything at all with this film.","Just boredom and sadness for the way the father is treated (although I know it’s not his children’s fault)."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]
["480896","7249","English","Spanish",["A Christmas Carol (2009)","I have just seen the Disney version of A Christmas Carol.","As many people, I already knew the story written by Charles Dickens.","When I saw the trailer, though, I wanted to watch the movie.","I remember that it seemed dark and a little bit funny.","Later, I read something about it, although I don’t remember from which website, and it criticized the filmed because it wasn’t for children, although it was from Disney.","Anyway, I watched it today.","At first, it’s quite a usual one, but when Scrooge gets to his home and sees that type of aura on his door house… It gets pretty scary, really.","The appearance of his old fellow is not better: the sudden appearance after the noises and the silence, his sudden changes of mood, the appearance of a lot of ghosts after his disappearance… ","If this wasn’t enough, there are more horrible views: the dislocating jaw of the ghost (although it gets quite funny when he tries to talk), the ghost of the present dying, his skin drying out, turning into a skeleton, the representation of the ignorance turning to violence, the want turning to prostitution, all the madness involved in this characters…","I want to make something clear: it’s not like I think that it’s a bad movie.","I actually enjoyed it.","But… I’m not sure if I would want my little cousins to watch it.","Well, for grown-up children it might be OK, but… for little children… I don’t think so.","By the way, something I just wanted to say: the laughter of the ghost of the present drives me mad.","I hate it!","I couldn’t bear listening to him any more!","I’m lucky it ended."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["1099959","310575","English","Spanish",["Where is my head?","You would not believe what happened to me this morning.","I wake up at 6 o’clock like I always do.","Althought the alarm rang I was already awake.","I turned it off and I got up feeling my naked feet on the floor.","It did not bother me.","I like the cold touch of the wood floor under the soles of my feet.","For me, this is my first treat with daily reality, something like a frontier between the world of dreams (and deads) and the tangible world.","I went forward the corridor to bath room and, there, after piss the beer of the eve, I had a shower.","I was hangover.","‘Too much beer’ I thought and I decided that a cold shower could be a fast, effective solution.","I put under running water and what was my surprise when the cold water oversteped my head straight to my neck.","Oh my God!","I had no head.","I had nothing on my shoulders.","Now, a few hours later, I’m in front of my computer without knowing what to do.","I’m scared and I don’t dare to try touching my head, but the reflection of the monitor confirms my suspicions: I’m a man without a head.","What can I do?"],[[],[],["I [f-blue]woke [\/f-blue]up at 6 [sline]o’clock[\/sline] like I always do. ["620992","72273","English","Spanish",["About Clocks","Well, dealing with the time is always annoying, but it is necessary.","I never liked to wear a watch on my hand.","Instead of that I took its bracelets off, and I carried it in my pocket.","I would say that I prefer clocks to watches.","In my house, there is a clock in the leaving room, there I watched the time.","When the battery of the clock is over; we take the clock down, so that the people doesn´t get confused with a wrong time.","But the clock is still filling that space in our mind.","We always are looking into that direction, and it is sad to see that empty space.","Besides, because of the shadow of the clock, that space has a more colorful paint than the rest of the wall.","Color tells us that there is something missing there, that a clock must occupy his right place, that we have to move on and charge the battery of the clock.","In the university I don't need watches either.","I am aware about the places where the clocks are standing.","For example, there is one in the entrance of the library.","There is another in the cafeteria, and there is another in the office of the dean.","And clock has other advantages; they are used by many people, instead of watches, which are used only by few people.","Besides, sometimes people get angry when someone asks for the time.","I think that that kind of people shouldn't own watches."],[["Clocks"],["[f-blue]D[\/f-blue]ealing with [f-blue]time [\/f-blue]is always annoying, but it is necessary."],["I never liked to wear a watch on my hand. Are you referring to the past, or the present perfect? If this is the past and is no longer the case, then write: I never used to like to wear a watch. If you still don´t like wearing them, write: I have never liked to wear a watch. However, this does sound a little awkward. I think that the liking is superfluous- we often say that we like to do this or dislike doing that not to focus on the emotion but rather a habit. That said, it might be best to say: I never used to wear a watch\/I never wore a watch (when I was younger)\/I have never worn a watch\/I never wear a watch. By the way, we wear watches on our wrists, not our hands, (they used to be called wristwatches to distinguish them from pocketwatches, but this term is now archaic). This piece of information is usually not necessary since it is taken for granted, but I can see how it might be necessary because of your next sentence."],["Instead[f-blue],[\/f-blue] I took [f-blue]the[\/f-blue] [f-blue]bands\/straps [\/f-blue]off, and I carried it in my pocket."],[],["In my house, there is [f-blue](or there used to be?)[\/f-blue] a clock in the [f-blue]living[\/f-blue] room [f-blue]where [\/f-blue]I [f-blue]could see what [\/f-blue]time[f-blue] it was. the painter has to paint one static image, and what is most important in his pieces of art is the composition of the scene.","Other important aspect of poetry is that the poet can sing about visible and invisibles things.","But painters can only paint visible things.","They have to paint invisible things by symbols, such as clouds or other similar things.","Lessing explain these aspect through many examples in Greek literature and painting, especially Iliad by Homer."],[["Beyond [f-blue]the [\/f-blue]limits of poetry and painting"],["I am reading a book by Lessing, entitled, 'Laocoon.'"],["Its title is \"Laocoon[f-blue].[\/f-blue]\"","[sline]Its title is \"Laocoon\".[\/sline][f-blue] (this is a way to put the two sentences together)[\/f-blue]"],["Th[f-blue]e[\/f-blue] book analy[f-blue]z[\/f-blue]e[f-blue]s[\/f-blue] the relationship between poetry and painting."],["Sometimes they have similarities, and sometimes they are completely [f-blue]different[\/f-blue]."],["Poetry is always dealing with [f-blue]the [\/f-blue]passing of time, [f-blue]i.[\/f-blue]"],["[f-blue]e.[\/f-blue]"],["[f-blue]actions [\/f-blue]through time."],["On the other hand, in painting you cannot paint [sline]the [\/sline]time; ["863729","72273","English","Spanish",["Nushu","Two years ago I was working as an assistant Spanish teacher at my university.","Every week the teacher gave the students some readings and they had to extract main idea sentences, topic sentences, and also summarize the texts.","My duty was scoring all their works.","Most of the time, the readings were quite boring; however, once there was an interesting and good one.","It was about the Nushu, a very recent extinct language spoken only for women.","On September 23 of 2004, the old woman Yang Huanyi, the last person speaking that language, died; along with the language.","The Nushu had created 1700 years ago for women and it had been passed from generation to generation.","I would think about that language a great deal.","I thought that women could come closer each other thanks to that language.","Humans are always creating signs: when we look, when we walk, when we just exist.","All those signs are disperse all everywhere, although.","To gather all that signs and be able to put them together in a coherent way by creating a language is such a great feat.","With Nushu women put men apart.","The language was a closed area only for women.","There was not a doorway for men.","However it seems that men haven’t learned their lesson yet.","To create a language means that beings who comprehend it can come closer, but it also means moving away those who can’t understand its signs.","I think of lovers, for example.","They can create a language that only they can understand, and nobody else in the world can come closer than they already are.","All the people are beyond the bounds they create.","However like Nushu, a language that has died, many loves die too.","I have three languages right now: Spanish, English, and my lover and I’s language.","I care about those languages, I am always learning new things, and the more important thing for preventing the extinction of a language, I am always creating new words in those languages.","I love my three languages; ["544495","72273","English","Spanish",["Cultivation","John abandoned the city, and moved into his farm.","There, he found a lot of adversities: a lot of rats aggregated very fast, and damaged his crops.","He decided to posion them.","John enjoyed cultivating tomatoes.","He fertilized them more than any other crop.","Each month, he intensified the amount of fertilizers for his crops.","This way, he obtained better vegetables.","Not only fertilizers, but also precipitation aided to cultivation."],[[],["John abandoned the city[sline],[\/sline] and moved into his farm."],["There, he [sline]found a lot of[\/sline] [f-red]encountered many [\/f-red]adversities[f-red], including[\/f-red] a [sline]lot[\/sline] [f-red]pack [\/f-red]of rats [sline]aggregated[\/sline] [f-red]that grew [\/f-red]very [sline]fast [\/sline][f-red]quickly[\/f-red] and damaged his crops. [f-blue]Adversities (a formal word, but it seems appropriate in this formal writing) are trials and problems that one discovers\/encounters in the process; they are not mere \"things\" just waiting to be found. The phrase \"a lot of\" sounds too informal in this piece. However, \"to aggregate\" is too formal... I had a general idea of what it meant but had to look it up to be sure. It is not commonly used. Finally, a group of rats is a pack of rats.[\/f-blue]"],["He decided to po[f-red]is[\/f-red]on them."],[],[],["Each month, he [sline]intensified[\/sline] [f-red]increased [\/f-red]the amount of fertilizer[sline]s[\/sline] for his crops."],["[sline]This way[\/sline] [f-red]By doing this[\/f-red], he obtained better vegetables."],["[sline]Not only[\/sline] [f-red]In addition to the [\/f-red]fertilizer[sline]s,[\/sline] [sline]but also[\/sline] precipitation [f-red]also [\/f-red]aided to cultivation. [f-blue]Do you want to say \"added to\" the cultivation? Or \"aided\" the cultivation? I can´t tell if it´s a spelling or grammar mistake. Also, the \"not only... but also\" construction is technically all right, but it sounds unnatural and sounds (to me) highly like a forced translation from Spanish (no solo... sino también). Maybe somebody else would think differently, but I think it sounds unnatural. [\/f-blue]"]]]
["557347","72273","English","Spanish",["Idioms with \"Bird\"","Today, I studied a lesson on the internet.","It was about some idioms with the word “bird”.","The first idiom was, “A little bird told me”.","This expression is used when we don’t want to tell somebody who told us some information.","In Spanish this expression is quite similar, I mean, we also say, “Un pájaro me lo dijo”.","The second expression was, “You eat like a bird”.","This expression is used to express that somebody doesn’t eat too much.","In Spanish it’s the same since we say, “come como un pajarito”.","The third expression was, “The early bird gets the worm”.","This expression means that the first one doing something will get obtain a benefit or something.","In Spanish it’s completely different as we say, “Al que madruga, Dios le ayuda”.","The fourth expression was, “A bird in the hand is better than 2 in the bush”.","It means it’s better to have something for sure than to possibly have something better in ["575757","72273","English","Spanish",["About Extra Textual Analysis","Performing extra textual analysis on a text is fundamental in both translation of natural sciences texts and social sciences texts.","Extra textual analysis is a powerful and essential tool for fulfilling a fine translation of a given text, since before of translating a text it is necessary to understand it.","It can not be said that extra textual analysis is more complex in one type of text than in the other one.","In both of the two types of texts is presented a rich amount of extra textual information such as cultural aspects or relationships among the different fields of the science.","For example, in the paper, “Salvador Dalí or the Persistence of Memories –True and False”, it is vital to be aware of who Sigmund Freud, André Breton and Federico García Lorca were, besides it is important to posses a knowledge of the Surrealist Movement, since Dalí was one its main members.","To understand and then translate this article it is necessary to know about Dalí personality which was always very close to his pieces of work.","If you misunderstand what the author are saying, then some mistakes in the translation could appear.","In the text, “Cloning Protocol of Aloe Vera as a Study-Case for ‘Tailor-Made’ Biotechnology to Small Farmers”, the translator should be aware of some fields of the biology as biotechnology and cloning.","It is not enough to translate what an author says in his text, the translator should be a kind of erudite and know the relationships among the text he is translating and other similar texts."],[["About Extra Textual Analysis"],["Performing extra textual analysis on a text is fundamental in translation of [f-blue]both[\/f-blue] natural sciences texts and social sciences texts.","Performing extra textual analysis on a text is fundamental in both translation of natural sciences texts and social sciences texts. [f-blue]The other commenter is right. In my experience, that phrase is actually not used very much (at least not anymore), although I know it's one of those funny phrases English learners always learn right away! You can say, \"It's raining cats and dogs out there\/here!\" or \"Yesterday, it was (really) raining cats and dogs.\" Other ways to express the same idea are \"raining buckets,\" \"pouring down\" or just \"raining hard.\" You could also say that you loved when there were big storms. All of these phrases are more common than the animal one. ["1078884","72273","English","Spanish",["Every time that I look for you, you are not here (UPDATED)","Sure, art can be like life.","One can find art everywhere: things made by human beings, things made by nature, or things made by god.","Art is so immense and ungraspable and ineffable.","When art is present in a novel or in a short story, it is something created by a mind, it is something that has to do with imagination (even if it is based in reality).","Sure, art can be like life.","I can find a good example with photography.","I lucubrate sometimes about how it is possible for art to manifest within a picture.","The picture is something that was “true”.","The art is possible mainly because of two things: the composition of the scene and the eye of the camera.","The eye of the camera is nothing more than the eye of the artist, the eye of a person.","Life can be lived in just one way.","How can you like an artistic life?","Can a hog live an artistic life?","Let’s imagine a big hog.","Well, it is a creature of god, and it is wonderful; ["760067","72273","English","Spanish",["Amazed by Juan Rulfo","Amazed by Juan Rulfo","Gabriel García Márquez","The day I discovered Juan Rulfo will be, without any doubts, a main chapter in my memories, as the day I discovered Franz Kafka.","I will tell the story.","I had arrived to México the same day that Ernest Hemingway killed himself with a gun’s shot, on July 2, 1961; and I have to admit that I hadn’t read Rulfo’s books yet, and what’s more I hadn’t even heard anything about him.","I lived in an apartment, without elevator, on Renán Street, in Anzures colony.","We had a double matrix on the floor in the main dormitory, a cradle in the other room, and a table in the living room, with only two chairs that were useful for all, where I ate and wrote.","I was 32 years old.","I had made a brief journalist career in Colombia.","I had just stayed three useful and hard years in Paris, and eight months in New York.","In that moment, I just wanted to write movie scripts in Mexico.","The atmosphere literary in Mexico in those days were very similar to Colombia´s; and I felt great among them.","Six years before I had published my first novel, “The Leaf Storm”, and I also had three unpublished books: “No One Writes to the Colonel”, that appeared in that time in Colombia, “In Evil Hour”, that was published by Era Editorial, later by Vicente Rojo; and finally a short stories collection, “Big Mama’s Funeral”.","So I was a writer with five underground books, but it was not my real problem, since I hadn’t became a writer in order to become famous, but to be loved by my friends a little more.","I thought that I had already achieved that.","My big problem as a novelist was that after those books I felt to be in a blind alley.","I was looking everywhere how to escape from that.","I already knew those good and bad authors that could have teach me something, and, I felt spinning in concentric circles, although.","I didn’t consider myself exhausted; on the contrary, I felt that I still had to write many additional books.","It was just that I hadn’t found a convenient and poetic way to write them.","I was that way, when Álvaro Mutis went upstairs seven floors to my apartment with a box full of books.","He looked inside for the smallest one and gave it to me and told me with a smile on his face, “Read this thing, so that you can learn how to write”.","It was “Pedro Páramo” by Juan Rulfo.","This is a translation.","http:\/\/www.ciudadseva.com\/textos\/teoria\/opin\/ggm6.htm"],[["Amazed by Juan Rulfo","Amazed by Juan Rulfo"],["Amazed by Juan Rulfo","Amazed by Juan Rulfo"],["Gabriel García Márquez"],["The day I discovered Juan Rulfo will be, without any doubts, a main chapter in my memories, as the day I discovered Franz Kafka.","The day I discovered Juan Rulfo will be, without [f-red]a doubt[\/f-red], a main chapter in my memories. ["628988","72273","English","Spanish",["A Table is a Table","A Table is a Table by Peter Bichsel is one of my favorite short stories.","It is supposed to be a kids stories but that is rather far from reality.","I mean a kid could read the story but he wouldn’t be able to understand it, because it has to do with language.","Wittgenstein, the philosopher of language, said that the limit of our language is the limit of our world, which means ─I think so─ that everything outside of our language does not exist for us, because to imagine a language is to imagine a form of life.","Going back to the point.","I was saying that A Table is a Table has to do with language ─that very tough topic.","The plot of the story is about an old man who lives alone in a small room with only a few objects: a table, a bed, a clock, a chair, and an album.","The old man rarely talks to his neighbors.","He always is in gray.","He is very bored with his life and with his world, because every day is the same, nothing change.","One day he though: “why I called objects this way, I mean French call my bed ‘lit’, and they call the picture ‘tableau’.","And they understand each other.” According to that, he decided to change his world.","He said: “From now on I will call table to my bed, and my bed is going to be called clock, and I will call chair to my clock and all”.","He thought of that to be funny, and he laughed a lot.","Now he began to practice his new language.","He trained himself every day.","But he wanted to get farther.","He said: “From now on ‘get up’ means ‘see the time’, ‘see the time’ means ‘wake up’, etc…","Again, he practiced a lot for memorizing his new language.","Now he talked something like that.","“At 5 a.m. I see the time from my table”.","He began to translate the songs he remembered to his new language.","But, one day…","(To be continued)","The story is great.","Of course maybe (not, I am sure) I changed a bit the story, but it is not a big deal.","It is just for practice."],[[],["[f-blue]\"[\/f-blue]A Table is a Table[f-blue]\"[\/f-blue] by Peter Bichsel is one of my favorite short stories.","A Table is a Table, by Peter Bichsel, is one of my favorite short stories."],["It is supposed to be a [f-blue]children's story, [\/f-blue]but [f-blue]that is far from the case. ["644938","72273","English","Spanish",["Another, Other, Others, the Other and the Others","I decided to do a whole entry dedicated only to these difficult words.","It has just been frustrating that always I use them in a sentence, I get many corrections.","The other day my mom said to me, “I have bought some caps.","One of them is red, another is green, another is yellow, and the other is purple.","Which one do you prefer?” I said, “None of those colors is one of my favorite, can you buy me another (one)?”  ─Can I use both “another” or “another one” in that last question with the same meaning?","She got upset; “Who do you think you are.","I have only these ones.","If you want other cap, then buy it yourself.","I have five sons.","And you are always the only one who is not happy with the things that I buy, why don’t you be like the others (or should I say like “your other siblings”)?” She claimed."],[[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[],[]]]

["390767","72273","English","Spanish",["The Pictures of the Cavemen","Painting was born around 20.000 year ago, in the caves of the cavemen.","In that time the cavemen didn't know how to keep cattle, and didn't know anything about farming, either.","So they used hunting as unique way of surviving.","It is courious because in that time they didn't have suitable tools for hunting large animals, like buffalos or deers.","They began painting those animals on the wall of their caves, then they jabbed the pictures with their spears or threw stones against it, so that they were able to kill those same animal in reality.","It was like magic, they killed the images, in order to killed them for real.","They didn't paint for entertaiment.","And every image was useful once, because you cannot kill a real animal twice."],[["[f-blue]Pictures[\/f-blue] of [f-blue]Cavemen[\/f-blue]"],["[f-blue]These[\/f-blue] painting[f-blue]s[\/f-blue] [f-blue]were made[\/f-blue] around 20[f-blue],[\/f-blue]000 ["733368","72273","English","Spanish",["How to Cry Properly","It doesn’t matter the reasons, we will go by the proper way to cry, I mean, a crying that not turn into something shocking nor something that insult a smile for its parallel and clumsy similarity.","A common crying consists of a contraction of the face and a jerky sound along with tears and snots.","The snots come at the end, because the crying stops when people blows his or her nose vigorously.","In order to cry, think about yourself, but if this is hard for you, maybe because you are so accustom to believe in the outside world, think about a duck covered with ants or about any of those gulfs in the Strait of Magellan, where nobody never enters.","When the crying has come, you should cover your face with decorum using both hands with the palms of the hand towards inside.","The kids should cry with the sleeve of their jacket covering their face, and preferably in a corner of the room.","The crying should take about three minutes.","This is a translation of Julio Cortázar's \"Instrucciones para llorar\"."],[[],["[f-blue]Ignoring [\/f-blue]the reasons[f-blue] for\/causes [f-blue]of the tears[\/f-blue][\/f-blue], we will [f-blue]concern ourselves only with [\/f-blue]the proper way to cry[f-blue]. ["677561","72273","English","Spanish",["Staying at home","I’ve recently been staying at home on Friday nights.","Somewhere in the past I stopped going out.","I don’t know what the reasons were.","I guess it’s just that people changes.","I remember that all weeks long, I used to look forward the weekend to come in order to go out to the bar.","I used to get a bit drunk all the weekend long, from Friday to Sunday.","But now it’s completely different, it looks like I’m moving to some other directions.","It’s not that I think that there is something wrong about going out so frequently or getting drunk; just that I feel more comfortable staying at home.","I remember that when I couldn’t go out for some reason on the weekend, I stayed restless at home.","Now, I love staying at home.","Most of the time, I stayed reading some book.","I like to read about history, literature, and math.","Once in a while I visit the bar I used to go, and I feel now like a completely strange.","Some friends of mine that used to go there too move to other town, or other neighborhood.","I think that we get fond of places because of people who we could find there.","There is nothing special with places at all.","We could get fond of a place for either, there we find people we liked or that place brings us back some memories of people that used to pass by.","It’s not like I’m enclosed by walls; as Emily Dickinson said, “There is no frigate like a book \/ To take us lands away.”"],[[],[],["[f-blue]At some point [\/f-blue]in the past I stopped going out."],["I don’t know what the reasons were. you take it from?\"","When he was an adolescent, he traveled to Santiago, the capital city.","There he began to study at university.","At the age of 19 he wrote 20 poems of love and a song of despair.","That book would become the favorite text of many people.","Then he began to travel and travel around the world.","He visited Singapur, Spain, Mexico, Peru, and all.","In 1971 he won the Nobel Prize.","He died in 1973 in Chile.","Here is something from him:","Sonnet XXVII:","Naked, you are simple as one of your hands,","Smooth, earthy, small, transparent, round:","You have moonlines, applepathways:","Naked, you are slender as a naked grain of wheat.","Naked, you are blue as the night in Cuba;","You have vines and stars in your hair;","Naked, you are spacious and yellow","As summer in a golden church.","Naked, you are tiny as one of your nails,","Curved, subtle, rosy, till the day is born","And you withdraw to the underground world,","as if down a long tunnel of clothing and of
